guides.label: Write for Everyone
guides.description: Use everyday, beginner-friendly language. Avoid jargon or overly technical terms unless absolutely necessary, and explain them if used.

guides.label: Keep it Short
guides.description: Aim for 1–2 clear sentences per simplified definition. Imagine you’re explaining it to a curious 12-year-old.

guides.label: No Dashes or Complex Formatting
guides.description: Avoid using long dashes or overly structured formats, keep it conversational and human.

guides.label: Stay True to its Meaning
guides.description: While simplifying, don’t distort the original meaning. Cross-check with the standard definition to ensure accuracy.

guides.label: Use the Stickman Style
guides.description: All illustrations should follow the playful, minimalist stickman style we've adopted, simple shapes, clear actions, and expressive gestures.

guides.label: Match the Definition
guides.description: Illustrations should visually represent the simplified definition of the term, helping users understand it at a glance.

guides.label: White Background Only
guides.description: Keep all illustrations on a plain white background to maintain visual consistency across the project.

guides.label: Use Vector Format
guides.description: Submit your illustrations as scalable vector graphics (SVG or high-res PNG) to ensure they remain sharp and adaptable.
